content.question: A launcher can launch a projectile with initial speed <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> from the edge of a tabletop at any angle between <math alttext="0 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">°</mi></math> and <math alttext="90 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>90</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">°</mi></math> above the horizontal. How does the horizontal component of the projectile’s velocity change as a function of launch angle as the angle is increased from <math alttext="0 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">°</mi></math> to <math alttext="90 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>90</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">°</mi></math> ?

choices.label: It decreases from a maximum value to zero at a constant rate.
It decreases from a maximum value to zero at a rate with an increasing magnitude.
It increases from zero to a maximum value at a constant rate.
It increases from zero to a maximum value at a rate with an increasing magnitude.

content.answer: It decreases from a maximum value to zero at a rate with an increasing magnitude.

topic.text: 1.5: Vectors and Motion in Two Dimensions

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
